title: Sampler, 1601–50
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in tent, half cross, chain, running, and encroaching Gobelin stitches in silk;  crossed chain, plaited braid, back, ladder, and chain stitch over double ladder stitc
description: "Spot" sampler with flowers, fragments of repeating pattern, a snail, a deer, a fish, and a falconer.  Traces of original ink drawing can be seen on foundation. Many areas have practice stitches.  Selvedge top and bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1601–50.
1601–50. Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in tent, half cross, chain, running, and encroaching Gobelin stitches in silk;  crossed chain, plaited braid, back, ladder, and chain stitch over double ladder stitc. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-38.
